pullRequest.title: Identity provider UI
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR implements a new UI for the authentication service management.
/jenkins-pr-deps Graylog2/graylog-plugin-enterprise#1774

commit.message: Remove redundant error prop type in Input
Change key for enterprise group sync plugin
Use active directory specific help text on backend create
Use understandable css selector in SectionComponent

nodes.bodyText: This should be from type password to hide the users password in the browser!

As it might be, here we are displaying raw data. It is not created in the frontend but in the backend. We might not even know how it looks, because it might be different depending on our authentication server we try to test again:
So I prefer:

over this:

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      Beside the builtin authentication mechanisms like its internal user database or LDAP/Active Directory,
          
          
            
                      Beside the built-in authentication mechanisms like its internal user database or LDAP/Active Directory,
or built in. I am only sure that there is no builtin at least in my dictionaries 😄
For some reason I do not know the catch did not catch my 404 (because there was no working backend). Which lead into an ever rotating spinner button. It is a minor issue but I wanted to mention it.
I do not know how it look right now, since I am not that advanced in testing, but I would recommend to do the error message in a mono font.
This is a bit awkward, that you define it here but never use it in this component. Perhaps move it to its own file. What do you think?
Love it 💟 . But avoid having a hooks file. Do for every hook its own file. But perhaps a hooks folder?

commit.message:
Introduce EncryptedValue and related classes

This class contains an encrypted value and its salt. I can be used when
sensitive data must be stored in the database.

It comes with a custom JSON serializer and deserializer. They serialize
and deserialize the value in different ways depending on the context.
When storing/reading the value in/from MongoDB, the literal content
(encrypted value and salt) are read/written.
In all other contexts, the serialized JSON only contains an indicator if
the value is set or not. When parsing the JSON, only a "set_value" field
is allowed to set a new value.

The deserializer automatically creates an encrypted value and salt from
the given new plain text value.
Extract TrustManagerProvider into its own file so it can be reused
Fix setting auth service attributes on User

Fix user provisioning

We need to set an encrypted password value when creating a user.
Include backend type in realm string in returned SimpleAccount
Add missing user attributes to UserOverviewDTO
Fall back to default backend if active backend doesn't work
Return null instead of a 404 if there is no active backend
Add LdapEntry#getNonBlank and add some more tests

Encrypt user password before passing it on to authentication services

This ensures that we don't expose it by accident (e.g. logging it)
All consumers need to decrypt it before they can use it.
Reduce log level for some log statements
Add auth service backend test code
Don't run authentication services for the "root_username" user

Use an explicit authenticating realm order instead of the dynamic one

Also disable binding of the legacy LDAP and MongoDB realm.s
Add TestPasswordSecretModule for guice injections in testing
Add missing audit annotations to resources
Refactor AuthenticationPage and add a getting started description
